title: E93-1066

sentences.text: This poster paper describes a full scale two-level morphological description -LRB- Karttunen , 1983 ; Koskenniemi , 1983 -RRB- of Turkish word structures .
The description has been implemented using the PC-KIMMO environment -LRB- Antworth , 1990 -RRB- and is based on a root word lexicon of about 23,000 roots words .
Almost all the special cases of and exceptions to phonological and morphological rules have been implemented .
Turkish is an agglutinative language with word structures formed by productive affixations of derivational and inflectional suffixes to root words .
Turkish has finite-state but nevertheless rather complex morphotactics .
Morphemes added to a root word or a stem can convert the word from a nominal to a verbal structure or vice-versa , or can create adverbial constructs .
The surface realizations of morphological constructions are constrained and modified by a number of phonetic rules such as vowel harmony .

summary: This poster paper describes a full scale two-level morphological description -LRB- Karttunen , 1983 ; Koskenniemi , 1983 -RRB- of Turkish word structures . The description has been implemented using the PC-KIMMO environment -LRB- Antworth , 1990 -RRB- and is based on a root word lexicon of about 23,000 roots words . Almost all the special cases of and exceptions to phonological and morphological rules have been implemented . Turkish is an agglutinative language with word structures formed by productive affixations of derivational and inflectional suffixes to root words . Turkish has finite-state but nevertheless rather complex morphotactics . Morphemes added to a root word or a stem can convert the word from a nominal to a verbal structure or vice-versa , or can create adverbial constructs . The surface realizations of morphological constructions are constrained and modified by a number of phonetic rules such as vowel harmony .

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' connects a subject (typically an individual or entity) to an object that represents a concept, phenomenon, or system of rules, indicating that the subject has expertise, knowledge, or insight into the nature and characteristics of the object.

Predicate-has_been_implemented_using.label: has been implemented using
Predicate-has_been_implemented_using.description: Indicates that a subject (typically an artifact or system) utilizes or relies on another entity (the object), which has been used to develop, design, or construct it. This predicate highlights the connection between the subject and the object as being instrumental in bringing about its existence or functionality.

Predicate-and_is_based_on.label: and is based on
Predicate-and_is_based_on.description: The predicate 'and is based on' indicates that the subject has its foundation or underlying structure established by the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests a relationship of dependence, where the subject's existence, properties, or behavior are rooted in or derived from the characteristics or principles described by the object.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' connects a subject to its inherent or defining characteristic, property, or classification. It indicates that the subject possesses or exemplifies the quality described by the object.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a relationship of possession or association between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject possesses, owns, or is characterized by the quality or attribute described in the object.

Predicate-formed_by.label: formed by
Predicate-formed_by.description: The predicate 'formed by' indicates a relationship of origin or composition between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has been created, developed, or structured through the agency or influence of the object.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship where the subject employs or exploits the object to achieve some purpose, convey meaning, or accomplish a task. The connection between the subject and object suggests that the subject relies on or utilizes the object's properties, characteristics, or functions in order to operate effectively.

Predicate-convert.label: convert
Predicate-convert.description: The predicate 'convert' indicates a transformational relationship between the subject and object, where the subject (typically an entity capable of modification) alters its form, structure or function to match the description provided by the object. This conversion can involve changes in grammatical category, semantic meaning, or both.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: Indicates that a subject relies on or has its foundation in an object. This predicate suggests a relationship of dependence, where the subject's existence, meaning, or validity is tied to the information, principles, or concepts contained within the object.

Predicate-are_based_on.label: are based on
Predicate-are_based_on.description: Indicates that the subject's content or structure is derived from or grounded in the object. This predicate suggests a relationship of dependence, where the subject relies on the object as its foundation, inspiration, or justification.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To convey or express a representation of something about an object or concept, often involving a detailed and accurate portrayal.

skos:broader.label: are constrained and modified
skos:broader.description: This predicate indicates a relationship where the subject's properties or characteristics are influenced by external factors, resulting in modifications that shape its form or behavior. The object represents the specific context, system, or language within which these constraints and modifications occur.
